Description: Pedestal foot sherd (concave on both faces) of Attic black-glazed pottery cup; flaring edge of foot in two degrees, upper one taller and concave; very fine make; glazed black on top and lower moulding, rest reserved; inscription cut on underside.
Curator's comments: The shape of the foot suggests a product of the broadly Nikosthenic workshop or rather its followers; compare British Museum 1843,1103.9 ( E38), potted by Python.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIV, no. 491)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 673, no. 317)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.2018)
